page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This Block centres on the villages of West Auckland and St.Helen Auckland, set in the broad valley of the river Gaunless.The land rises from 350 feet at the river,which meanders from west to east, to approx. 600ft.along the north and south of the block.The A688 road crosses the area N.E._S.W., intersecting the A68 which runs S.E._ N.W. Once a coal mining area,spoil heaps have now been landscaped and a number of factories provide most of the jobs in an area of high unemploy_ ment. Historic buildings in West Auckland are: Manor House (16th.cent_ ury,now an hotel) and Old Hall(17th. century).In St.Helen Auckland: 12th. century church; Manor(16th.century) and Hall (17th.century). In the east,the block includes part of a council housing estate in the town of Bishop Auckland.
